column4: I got this from a webpage modprobe usbserial vendor=0x413c product=0x8137
but I get arror FATAL: Module usbserial not found.
do you often do what a webpage recommends without understanding what it's asking?
yeah, but you conveniently forgot to tell US what you need to do
Dell Wireless 5520 Generic Mobile Broadband 3G HSDPA
good news/bad news.  ther's a bug on it.  investigating
A newer kernel (2.6.27-2-generic, latest from intrepid) now detects the device without any changes being required to option.c or any explicit forcing of module loading.
still, uname -a to be sure, and did you reboot?
Hmm  I feel abit stupid , haven't that on my system
you do, it's the networking icon on the taskbar
not all the time, just for now to prove everything's working
I understand will test it :) I gues apt-get install x ?
not really, ubuintu is pretty much going to have X unless you specifically uninstalled it
I'll report back how it went
